message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.IR 

The paper deals with face recognition using deep learning techniques, specifically addressing the problem of recognizing very low-resolution faces captured by CCTV cameras. This falls under the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. The paper proposes a novel deep architecture that involves a Face Hallucination sub-Net (FHN) and a Heterogeneous Recognition sub-Net (HRN), which are jointly learned end to end. This suggests that the paper may also fall under the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The paper also uses a tri-path Generative Adversarial Network (GAN) and a residual knowledge distillation strategy, which are techniques commonly used in multimedia (cs.MM) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) research. Finally, the paper evaluates its proposed model on several benchmarks, indicating that it may also fall under the information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category.
